poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: The tyke was a wee Jack Russell Barrel-chested and bow-legged. My dad had it put down when my mother died. The trike was a big maroon thing - pavements only, no two-wheelers - With a big kind of beige breadbasket At the back, for toys and messages. I mind it going completely out of control down from Angus Oval, Me having to take a header through a hedge.
